description: This topics-based survey course examines the basic principles of psychological science within a
given subdiscipline. Students use critical thinking skills to examine fascinating topics such as:
language development, health psychology, spirituality, education, learning and memory, choice and
decision-making, hormones and behavior, perception, sensation, neuroethics, cultural psychology,
neuropsychology, and lifespan development. Students apply basic principles from introductory
psychology and act as skeptical scientists. This course applies to many career choices in today's
world and provides insight into self and others. May be repeated if topic is different. Offered
